name: v2.3.1
body: `v2.3.1` patches an issue with function shortcuts raised in PR #61.

name: v2.3.0
body: `v2.3.0` patches various issues relating to Tinx's `tableless_models` configuration option.

name: v2.2.0
body: `v2.2.0` adds a `reo()` function to regenerate Composer's optimized autoload files before running `re()`, ensuring any new classes added to a codebase since starting Tinx are automatically aliasable/resolvable by Laravel Tinker (see #53).

name: v2.1.9
body: `v2.1.9` was created to test Packagist's service hook (adds no fixes/functionality).

name: v2.1.8
body: `v2.1.8` only creates the `/storage/tinx/.gitignore` file if it doesn't exist.

name: v2.1.7
body: `v2.1.7` adds support for Laravel 5.7.

name: v2.1.6
body: `v2.1.6` added the "--dev" option to the README's `composer require` statement.

name: v2.1.5
body: `v2.1.5` is the [verified](https://blog.github.com/2016-04-05-gpg-signature-verification/) release of [`v2.1.3`](https://github.com/furey/tinx/releases/tag/v2.1.3).

name: v2.1.4
body: `v2.1.4` is exactly the same as `v2.1.3` (created `v2.1.3` via SourceTree instead of GitHub, without GPG signing, and in an attempt to fix, accidentally created this patch bump release).

name: v2.1.3
body: `v2.1.3` restores lost `re()` functionality due to class definition caching during model validation.

name: v2.1.2
body: `v2.1.2` changes a comment's syntax to support the `htmlmin/htmlmin` package.

name: v2.1.1
body: `v2.1.1` patches missing README shield links.

name: v2.1.0
body: `v2.1.0` adds Laravel 5.6 and PHPUnit 7 support, and changes README shields provider from `pugx.org` to `shields.io`.

name: v2.0.7
body: `v2.0.7` patches an issue preventing custom naming strategies from resolving correctly.

name: v2.0.6
body: `v2.0.6` adds Laravel <=5.4 service provider information to the repository README file.

name: v2.0.5
body: `v2.0.5` adds console messages when booting for Tinx applications where the total number of found model classes is greater than their `config/tinx.php` > `names_table_limit` value. For example, if an application's `names_table_limit` was set to `10`, a user might see:

name: Future safe composer.json
body: Laravel doesn't follow semver. So having ^5.x or >=5.x will mean that composer will install a future version even though that version breaks the package.

name: v2.0.3
body: `v2.0.3` patches a bug preventing PHP configurations with `short_open_tag = On` from rendering Tinx's `includes.blade.php` file correctly (the `<?` at the start of `<?placeholder` would throw a parse error).

name: v2.0.2
body: `v2.0.2` patches an unreliable static method call when checking model instantiation.

name: v2.0.1
body:
`v2.0.1` patches PHP 7.0 backwards incompatible syntax to support PHP 5.6.

**Note:**

If using PHP 5.6, Tinx shortcut function static methods (e.g. `u()::first()`) will fail:

```
>>> u()::first()
PHP Parse error: Syntax error, unexpected T_PAAMAYIM_NEKUDOTAYIM on line 1
```

Instead, cache your shortcut function class in a variable and call your static methods against that:

```
>>> $_u = u()
=> "App\User"
>>> $_u::first()
=> App\User {#752
     id: "1",
     name: "test",
     email: "test@test.com",
     created_at: "2017-11-26 03:26:23",
     updated_at: "2017-11-26 03:26:23",
   }
```

For more info, see: https://stackoverflow.com/q/38669459/1210490

name: v2.0.0
v1.0.1
body: `v1.0.1` patches a few documentation typos.

name: v1.0.0
body:
• Added "pascal" naming strategy/tests (replaces "shortestUnique" as default)
• Added console "Class/Shortcuts" table (replaces names(); filterable e.g. names('user'))
• Added "illuminate/container:~5.2" dependency (supporting back to Laravel 5.2)
• Significant architectural refactors
• Update README (including GIF)

name: v0.8.4
body: `v0.8.4` patches a Laravel 5.5 `FilesystemAdapter` method call that would cause Tinx to fail on earlier Laravel versions.

name: v0.8.3
body: `v0.8.3` loosens the exception check when trying to include class instances (was previously catching `Illuminate\Database\QueryException`; now simply catching `Exception`), catching and ignoring `Throwable` errors at the same time (e.g. models where query builder methods aren't defined i.e. class files that don't extend `Illuminate\Database\Eloquent\Model`).

name: v0.8.2
body: `v0.8.2` moves a `use` statement that should have been moved in `v0.8.1`.

name: v0.8.1
body: `v0.8.1` patches the "abstract detection via reflection" reload bug introduced in `v0.6`.
